metadata.synopsis: Two grouchy duergar, one a talker and one who somewhat mimics/ repeats what his partner says, are responsible for dumping dead gnome bodies into the lake. You can convince them to let you loot the bodies.
metadata.how_to_trigger: - loadlevel WLD_Main_A- goto -608.33, 0.39, 405.19- Speak to Viss or Brathwin

10.speaker: Brathwen
10.text: Where's your pickaxe, gnome? Thrinn know you're over here?

36.speaker: Viss
36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spits on the groundNodeContext: Said like a threat.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: She asked me to inspect the bodies for anything useful.

96.speaker: Brathwen
96.text: Get on with it then, and keep quiet.

26.speaker: Brathwen
26.text: You know - I don't think she did. I think you're trying to escape. We aren't gonna let that happen, are we, Viss?

15.speaker: Viss
15.context: NodeContext: Said matter-of-factly and threateningly, about to start combat.

74.speaker: Brathwen
74.text: Do what you can, then. Probably ain't much.

71.speaker: Brathwen
71.text: Thrinn don't believe in mixing work between us and you. No, I think you were trying to escape.

77.speaker: Brathwen
77.text: What do we do with runaways, Viss?

20.speaker: Viss
20.context: NodeContext: Said as a threat, since htis is about ot start combat.

29.speaker: Brathwen
29.text: Hold up, ya rat - I asked you a question. Thrinn know you're sniffing around?

88.speaker: Brathwen
88.text: 'Less you're here to kick some stiffs lake-side, I suggest you bugger off.
88.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera first pans acros the field of dead, then focuses on the duergar

73.speaker: Viss
73.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spit on the groundNodeContext: He spits on the ground, glowering.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: My friend, I play Goliath Goatball, Moon Hockey, and Pegasus Polo with corpses.

66.speaker: Brathwen
66.text: Urgh. Hate being taken all literal-like by fancy types like you.

32.speaker: Brathwen
32.text: We've work to do. Stuff your Pegasus where the rainbow don't shine.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: Grim work. Did you kill them?

34.speaker: Brathwen
34.text: Nah. Rockfall smashed 'em. Can't have them stinking up the place.

30.speaker: Brathwen
30.text: The half that weren't crushed are digging the True Soul outta the wreckage.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: I hope you're checking them for loot first?

89.speaker: Brathwen
89.text: You gotta be kidding. These trash don't have nothing on 'em but rocks.

91.speaker: Narrator
91.text: *You spot a shiny trinket on one of the corpses.*

35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reaches for the trinket and lifts it off the corpse, stashing it into their inventory behind the back.

7.speaker: Brathwen
7.text: Quit sniffin' around. You're starting to get on my nerves.

83.speaker: Narrator
83.text: *You reach for the trinket, but it's already gone.*
83.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player crouches and reaches for the corpse, but the trinket has already been taken by another player.

57.speaker: Brathwen
57.text: Hey, what're you - oh, I get it.

48.speaker: Brathwen
48.text: Something caught your eye, eh? That's grand. I'd be willing to let you take it, too, for a mere pittance.

31.speaker: Brathwen
31.text: Tidy. Hope you enjoy a bit of tat, you dolt.

4.speaker: Brathwen
4.text: Then get your face outta mine.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: I'll finish up here. You're wanted with the others.

41.speaker: Brathwen
41.text: Thank the Absolute. They're all yours.

98.speaker: Brathwen
98.text: I ain't goin' 'til Thrinn tells me to go.

85.speaker: Narrator
85.text: *For a moment you thought you'd seen something shining on one of the corpses. Suddenly, it's vanished.*
85.context: CinematicNodeContext: This is for the edge case in which someone steals the trinket in the space of 1 node. Probably will work best as another shot of the corpse, sans glittering metal.

8.speaker: Brathwen
8.text: Done gawking? Lend a hand or get gone.

0.speaker: Brathwen
0.context: CinematicNodeContext: The pushing of the corpse into the lake appears to be handled systemnically, so the camera can pan out and let animation take over.

70.speaker: Lae'zel
70.text: At ease. Observe, and learn. Once you are assured victory, then you strike.

46.speaker: Shadowheart
46.text: At least try to find out something of use before you kill them.
46.context: NodeContext: 'violence doesn't always have to be the first option, you know'

80.speaker: Karlach
80.text: Ooh, are we killing slavers? Me first!

40.speaker: Astarion
40.text: There's a time and a place for violence. I mean - this place is perfect, but is it the time?

81.speaker: Wyll
81.text: Go on - get it done. You've got me at your side.
81.context: NodeContext: In a low voice. Said to player, doesn't want others to hear.

23.speaker: Gale
23.text: Whoa, not so fast. Let's get the lay of the land before we settle on the scorched earth routine.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: Put your back into it. Lazy bastards.

60.speaker: Brathwen
60.text: Sod off, chum. I put more back in and I'm likely to break it.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: Sounds like a lark. I reckon I could kick a corpse farther than you.

5.speaker: Brathwen
5.text: It was a figure of speech, you lummox. We ain't looking for help.

68.speaker: Brathwen
68.text: Ain't looking for company neither. Take a walk - go find yerself a minotaur to wrestle or something.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: I've heard of many burial rites and last wishes in my time. Being tossed into fetid water is not one of them.

84.speaker: Brathwen
84.text: This ain't no funeral - this is taking out the rubbish. They served their purpose, and now they're fish food.

18.speaker: Brathwen
18.text: That's about the best end you can expect if you don't turn to the Absolute.
